alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 7:27AM CDT until June 02 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... La Moine River at Colmar affecting Hancock and McDonough Counties. For the La Moine River...including Colmar...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...La Moine River at Colmar. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.5 feet, Water affects lower roads around Birmingham. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 22.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.9 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued late this morning.
